owner can approve a third party address, such as a smart contract, to spend a proof on their behalf. This allows a batch approval of notes to be performed, rather than individually for each note via confidentialApprove().","params":{"_proofId":"- id of proof to be approved. Needs to be a balanced proof.","_proofOutputs":"- data of proof","_proofSignature":"- ECDSA signature over the proof, approving it to be spent","_spender":"- address being approved to spend the notes"}},"confidentialApprove(bytes32,address,bool,bytes)":{"details":"Note owner approving a third party, another address, to spend the note on owner's behalf. This is necessary to allow the confidentialTransferFrom() method to be called","params":{"_noteHash":"- keccak256 hash of the note coordinates (gamma and sigma)","_signature":"- ECDSA signature from the note owner that validates the confidentialApprove() instruction","_spender":"- address being approved to spend the note","_spenderApproval":"- defines whether the _spender address is being approved to spend the note, or if permission is being revoked. True if approved, false if not approved"}},"confidentialTransfer(bytes,bytes)":{"details":"Executes a basic unilateral, confidential transfer of AZTEC notes Will submit _proofData to the validateProof() function of the Cryptography Engine.    * Upon successfull verification, it will update note registry state - creating output notes and destroying input notes.","params":{"_proofData":"- bytes variable outputted from a proof verification contract, representing transfer instructions for the IACE","_signatures":"- array of the ECDSA signatures over all inputNotes"}},"confidentialTransfer(uint24,bytes,bytes)":{"details":"Executes a basic unilateral, confidential transfer of AZTEC notes Will submit _proofData to the validateProof() function of the Cryptography Engine.    * Upon successfull verification, it will update note registry state - creating output notes and destroying input notes.","params":{"_proofData":"- bytes variable outputted from a proof verification contract, representing transfer instructions for the IACE","_proofId":"- id of proof to be validated. Needs to be a balanced proof.","_signatures":"- array of the ECDSA signatures over all inputNotes"}},"confidentialTransferFrom(uint24,bytes)":{"details":"Executes a value transfer mediated by smart contracts. The method is supplied with transfer instructions represented by a bytes _proofOutput argument that was outputted from a proof verification contract.","params":{"_proof":"- uint24 variable which acts as a unique identifier for the proof which _proofOutput is being submitted. _proof contains three concatenated uint8 variables: 1) epoch number 2) category number 3) ID number for the proof","_proofOutput":"- output of a zero-knowledge proof validation contract. Represents transfer instructions for the IACE"}},"confidentialTransferSmartWallet(bytes,bytes)":{"details":"Executes a basic unilateral, confidential transfer of AZTEC notes Will submit _proofData to the validateProof() function of the Cryptography Engine.  * Upon successfull verification, it will update note registry state - creating output notes and destroying input notes.","params":{"_proofData":"- bytes variable outputted from a proof verification contract, representing transfer instructions for the IACE","_signatures":"- array of the ECDSA signatures over all inputNotes"}},"confidentialTransferSmartWallet(uint24,bytes,bytes)":{"details":"Executes a basic unilateral, confidential transfer of AZTEC notes Will submit _proofData to the validateProof() function of the Cryptography Engine.  * Upon successfull verification, it will update note registry state - creating output notes and destroying input notes.","params":{"_proofData":"- bytes variable outputted from a proof verification contract, representing transfer instructions for the IACE","_proofId":"- id of proof to be validated. nodes.name: confidentialTransferSmartWallet

nodes.documentation:
@dev Executes a basic unilateral, confidential transfer of AZTEC notes
Will submit _proofData to the validateProof() function of the Cryptography Engine.
  * Upon successfull verification, it will update note registry state - creating output notes and
destroying input notes.
  * @param _proofData - bytes variable outputted from a proof verification contract, representing
transfer instructions for the IACE
@param _signatures - array of the ECDSA signatures over all inputNotes

@dev Executes a basic unilateral, confidential transfer of AZTEC notes
Will submit _proofData to the validateProof() function of the Cryptography Engine.
  * Upon successfull verification, it will update note registry state - creating output notes and
destroying input notes.
  * @param _proofData - bytes variable outputted from a proof verification contract, representing
transfer instructions for the IACE
@param _signatures - array of the ECDSA signatures over all inputNotes

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "the note owner did not sign this message"

attributes.name: confidentialTransferInternalSmartWallet

attributes.type: function (bytes memory) pure returns (bytes memory,bytes memory,address,int256)

approveProof(uint24,bytes,address,bool,b.details: Note owner can approve a third party address, such as a smart contract, to spend a proof on their behalf. This allows a batch approval of notes to be performed, rather than individually for each note via confidentialApprove().

params._proofId: - id of proof to be approved. Needs to be a balanced proof.
params._proofSignature: - ECDSA signature over the proof, approving it to be spent
params._spender: - address being approved to spend the notes

confidentialApprove(bytes32,address,bool.details: Note owner approving a third party, another address, to spend the note on owner's behalf. This is necessary to allow the confidentialTransferFrom() method to be called

params._noteHash: - keccak256 hash of the note coordinates (gamma and sigma)
params._signature: - ECDSA signature from the note owner that validates the confidentialApprove() instruction
params._spender: - address being approved to spend the note
params._spenderApproval: - defines whether the _spender address is being approved to spend the note, or if permission is being revoked. True if approved, false if not approved

confidentialTransfer(bytes,bytes).details: Executes a basic unilateral, confidential transfer of AZTEC notes Will submit _proofData to the validateProof() function of the Cryptography Engine.    * Upon successfull verification, it will update note registry state - creating output notes and destroying input notes.

params._proofData: - bytes variable outputted from a proof verification contract, representing transfer instructions for the IACE
params._signatures: - array of the ECDSA signatures over all inputNotes

confidentialTransfer(uint24,bytes,bytes).details: Executes a basic unilateral, confidential transfer of AZTEC notes Will submit _proofData to the validateProof() function of the Cryptography Engine.    * Upon successfull verification, it will update note registry state - creating output notes and destroying input notes.

params._proofData: - bytes variable outputted from a proof verification contract, representing transfer instructions for the IACE
params._proofId: - id of proof to be validated. Needs to be a balanced proof.
params._signatures: - array of the ECDSA signatures over all inputNotes

confidentialTransferFrom(uint24,bytes).details: Executes a value transfer mediated by smart contracts. The method is supplied with transfer instructions represented by a bytes _proofOutput argument that was outputted from a proof verification contract.

params._proof: - uint24 variable which acts as a unique identifier for the proof which _proofOutput is being submitted. _proof contains three concatenated uint8 variables: 1) epoch number 2) category number 3) ID number for the proof
params._proofOutput: - output of a zero-knowledge proof validation contract. Represents transfer instructions for the IACE

confidentialTransferSmartWallet(bytes,by.details: Executes a basic unilateral, confidential transfer of AZTEC notes Will submit _proofData to the validateProof() function of the Cryptography Engine.  * Upon successfull verification, it will update note registry state - creating output notes and destroying input notes.

params._proofData: - bytes variable outputted from a proof verification contract, representing transfer instructions for the IACE
params._signatures: - array of the ECDSA signatures over all inputNotes

confidentialTransferSmartWallet(uint24,b.details: Executes a basic unilateral, confidential transfer of AZTEC notes Will submit _proofData to the validateProof() function of the Cryptography Engine.  * Upon successfull verification, it will update note registry state - creating output notes and destroying input notes.

params._proofData: - bytes variable outputted from a proof verification contract, representing transfer instructions for the IACE
params._proofId: - id of proof to be validated. Needs to be a balanced proof.
params._signatures: - array of the ECDSA signatures over all inputNotes

updateNoteMetaData(bytes32,bytes).details: Update the metadata of a note that already exists in storage.

params.metaData: - metadata to update the note with
params.noteHash: - hash of a note, used as a unique identifier for the note
